Ok I looked into it real quick. If we want the find-Package to match the version number we specify we need to pass `EXACT`
e.g
if we call `find_package(gazebo 8.2.0 REQUIRED)` and only 8.3.0 is installed it will succeed and link against whatever gazebo version is found
if we call `find_package(gazebo 8.2.0 EXACT REQUIRED)` and only 8.3.0 is installed the `find_package` call will fail(cmake output below). So if we want to ensure we're using the right version we should use `EXACT`

CMake output when requiring 8.2.0 and only 8.3.0 is installed:
```
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:12 (find_package):
  Could not find a configuration file for package "gazebo" that exactly
  matches requested version "8.2.0".

  The following configuration files were considered but not accepted:

    /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/gazebo/gazebo-config.cmake, version: 8.3.0

```
